title: Hast Thou Heard Him?
presentation: v1 c v2 c v3 c v4 c v5 c v6 c v7 c

v1: Hast thou heard Him, seen Him, known Him?
Is not thine a captured heart?
Chief among ten thousand own Him;
v2: Idols once they won thee, charmed thee,
Lovely things of time and sense;
Gilded thus does sin disarm thee,
Honeyed lest thou turn thee thence.
v3: What has stripped the seeming beauty
From the idols of the earth?
Not a sense of right or duty,
But the sight of peerless worth.
v4: Not the crushing of those idols,
With its bitter void and smart;
But the beaming of His beauty,
v5: Till they hail the rising sun?
Who discards the garb of winter
v6: 'Tis that heart that wept with Mary,
v7: Draw and win and fill completely,
Till the cup o'erflow the brim;
What have we to do with idols
c1: Let His peerless worth constrain thee,
